abstract.p: Unilever NV hopes to be first foreign company to sell shares to Chinese investors; seeks to list its Unilever China Ltd unit on Shanghai exchange (S)

block.p: The European food conglomerate Unilever N.V. hopes to be the first foreign company to sell shares to Chinese investors. Unilever has applied to list its Chinese holding company, Unilever China Ltd., on the Shanghai Stock Exchange. For now, foreign companies are permitted to list only so-called B shares on the country's two exchanges. Those shares, denominated in foreign currency, are off limits to Chinese nationals. China's market regulator has said it is considering allowing foreign companies to sell shares to domestic investors, but has given no timetable for when that might happen.
